item.description:
Please read the entire Write Up and understand that by signing up for the event you and any guests agree to the enclosed Liability Waiver.

Event Rating: Difficult
Distance: 8 Miles
Time Duration: ~4 Hours
Blaze Orange: not required

This is a hike of the Beach Pond area located south of Rt 165.  The hike follows a map and directions in “Walks in the Watershed”.

The distance is about 8 miles, and will take nearly four hours.The  hike has been rated "Difficult" for the combination of length, terrain, and planned pace. This is not a hike for first-timers in this group, nor for beginners. Please keep this in mind when considering signing up for the hike. 

This hike starts at Beach Pond on the Tippecansett Trail, and then brings us by Hemlock Ledges, and we will climb to the top of a scenic “Lookout” spot. After that we will follow the White Dot Trail, Dye Hill Trail, Brushy Brook Trail, and the Deep Pond Trails before we complete the hike.

 

View from "Lookout" with Beach Pond in the background.

 

Photo by nancy

Camera supplied by Nancy G

 

 

 

 

 

“Walks in the Watershed” calls this “a remote area of deep woods, streams, ponds, and hemlock-covered ledges” We will go by the ruins of a farm, cross a broken dam, and cross “hogback ridges”  We will check out Deep Pond, on the hike too.

With the rocky trails and stream crossings, a pair of hiking boots is strongly suggested. With the warm weather, come prepared with bug spray for protection from ticks and other insects. Bring sufficient water and snacks along for a 4 hour hike.

There is a chance for rain in the forecast. Be prepared with the right clothing in the event it rains during the hike. Rt 165 is currently under construction, so there may be unpaved sections of road and possible delays.

Directions

From Providence: Take I-95 south to exit 5A, (Rt. 102 south). At the merge of Rt. 102 and Rt. 3, take Rt. 3 south. Continue on Rt. 3 south for another mile to the next light (a flashing light) at the intersection of Rt. 3 and Rt. 165. Turn right at the flashing light onto Rt. 165 west. Follow Rt. 165 west for about 7 miles, until you come to Beach Pond. Park in the lot on the right side of the highway, and on the RI side of the pond. Using this lot will let us meet in one parking lot. The lot on the opposite side of Rt 165 is where we will start the hike, but parking is more limited there.

 

Liability Waiver:

As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you know and will follow the Hiker Responsibility Code described at www.hikesafe.com; the leader(s) of this activity are volunteers; and you for yourself, your heirs, executors, and administrators release, hold harmless, and indemnify the leader(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.

Safety First!

group.name: Rhode Island Hiking Club " Walks and Rambles "

item.name: Beach Pond - South
